intro: Sida spinifex, commonly known as coastal bluestem, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dunes and salt marshes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds. Sida spinifex plays an important role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
